## Purpose
Rich library component that displays renderables (text, widgets, etc.) in neat columnar layouts. Part of the Rich terminal formatting library ecosystem, providing flexible multi-column text arrangement with various alignment and sizing options.

## Core Class

**Columns (L16-172)**: Main class implementing JupyterMixin for columnar display of renderables
- **Constructor (L31-52)**: Initializes column layout with configurable padding, width, expansion, alignment, and ordering options
- **add_renderable (L54-60)**: Appends new renderable items to the column set
- **__rich_console__ (L62-171)**: Core rendering method that calculates optimal column layout and yields a Table grid

## Key Functionality

**Layout Algorithm (L78-143)**:
- Measures renderable widths using `Measurement.get()` (L78-82)
- Supports equal-width columns via max width normalization (L83-84)
- Auto-calculates column count to fit within max_width constraints (L128-142)
- Handles both left-to-right and column-first item ordering

**Item Arrangement (L86-118)**:
- `iter_renderables()`: Generator yielding (width, renderable) tuples
- Column-first mode (L90-111): Distributes items vertically then horizontally using 2D cell matrix
- Row-first mode (L113): Simple zip of widths and renderables
- Automatically pads incomplete rows with None values (L115-117)

**Rendering Pipeline (L144-171)**:
- Applies width constraints for equal-sized columns (L149-155)
- Applies alignment using Align wrapper (L156-162)
- Supports right-to-left column reversal (L164-170)
- Uses Table.grid() as underlying rendering mechanism (L119-121)

## Dependencies
- **Rich core**: Console, ConsoleOptions, RenderResult, RenderableType
- **Layout components**: Align, Constrain, Padding, Table, Measurement
- **Standard library**: defaultdict, chain, itemgetter for data manipulation

## Configuration Options
- `width`: Fixed column width vs auto-detection
- `padding`: Cell padding (default 0,1)
- `expand`: Full-width expansion
- `equal`: Force equal column widths
- `column_first`: Vertical-then-horizontal vs horizontal-then-vertical filling
- `right_to_left`: Column order reversal
- `align`: Text alignment within columns
- `title`: Optional column set title

## Usage Pattern
Designed for console applications needing organized multi-column output (file listings, data tables, etc.). Integrates seamlessly with Rich's rendering pipeline through `__rich_console__` protocol.
